metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: JavaScript if, else, and else if
Conditional statements are used to perform different actions based on different conditions.
content.html: Conditional statements are used to perform different actions based on different conditions.

content.text: Very often when you write code, you want to perform different actions for different decisions.
content.html: Very often when you write code, you want to perform different actions for different decisions.

content.text: You can use conditional statements in your code to do this.
content.html: You can use conditional statements in your code to do this.

content.text: In JavaScript we have the following conditional statements:
content.html: In JavaScript we have the following conditional statements:

content.text: The switch statement is described in the next chapter.
content.html: The switch statement is described in the next chapter.

content.text: Use the if statement to specify a block of JavaScript code to be executed if a condition is true.
content.html: Use the if statement to specify a block of JavaScript code to be executed if a condition is true.

syntaxHighlighting.text: //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true

syntax_highlighting.text: //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true

content.code_html:
if (condition) {
  //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true
 }

syntax_highlighting_data.text: //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true

content.text: Note that if is in lowercase letters. Uppercase letters (If or IF) will generate a JavaScript error.
content.html: Note that if is in lowercase letters. Uppercase letters (If or IF) will generate a JavaScript error.

content.code_html:
if (hour < 18) {
  greeting = "Good day";
}

content.text: Use the else statement to specify a block of code to be executed if the condition is false.
content.html: Use the else statement to specify a block of code to be executed if the condition is false.

syntaxHighlighting.text: //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition is false

syntax_highlighting.text: //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition is false

content.code_html:
if (condition) {
  //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true
 } else {
  //  block of code to be executed if the condition is false
 }

syntax_highlighting_data.text: //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition is false

content.code_html:
if (hour < 18) {
  greeting = "Good day";
} else {
  greeting = "Good evening";
}

content.text: Use the else if statement to specify a new condition if the first condition is false.
content.html: Use the else if statement to specify a new condition if the first condition is false.

syntaxHighlighting.text: //  block of code to be executed if condition1 is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is false

syntax_highlighting.text: //  block of code to be executed if condition1 is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is false

content.code_html:
if (condition1) {
  //  block of code to be executed if condition1 is true
 } else if (condition2) {
  //  block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is true
 } else {
  //  block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is false
 }

syntax_highlighting_data.text: //  block of code to be executed if condition1 is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is true
//  block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is false

content.code_html:
if (time < 10) {
  greeting = "Good morning";
} else if (time < 20) {
  greeting = "Good day";
} else {
  greeting = "Good evening";
}

let text;
if (Math.random() < 0.5) {
  text = "<a href='https://w3schools.com'>Visit W3Schools</a>";
} else {
  text = "<a href='https://wwf.org'>Visit WWF</a>";
}
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = text;

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
True or False. JavaScript allows both lowercase if and uppercase If statements.
content.html:
True or False.
JavaScript allows both lowercase if and uppercase If statements.

metadata.question: True or False.JavaScript allows both lowercase if and uppercase If statements.

content.question: True or False.JavaScript allows both lowercase if and uppercase If statements.
